context_of_use: The admin accesses the system to modify settings and preferences.
scope: System-wide configuration settings and application preferences.
description: Allow admins to configure system-wide settings and application preferences.
triggering_event: Admin initiates configuration of system settings.
preconditions: Admin is logged into the system.
Admin has the necessary permissions to configure settings.
postconditions: System settings are updated according to admin's configurations.
Changes are saved and applied to the system.
assumptions: Admin has knowledge of system settings.
requirements_met: Admin can save changes to system settings.
outstanding_issues: Potential for misconfiguration leading to system issues.
main_flow: 1. Admin navigates to system configuration settings → System displays configuration options.
2. Admin modifies desired settings → System accepts changes.
3. Admin saves changes → System confirms settings have been updated.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): Admin cancels configuration → System returns to previous screen without changes.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): Admin inputs invalid data → System displays error message and prompts for valid input.
